page.title: 01General Review
page.content: It is basically a farming area, mainly dairy.Much of the area is composed of green fields separated by hedges.There are small woods with deciduous trees.There are two villages,Rocester-of Roman origin,and Denstone-which is mentioned in the Domesday Book.Adjacent to Denstone is the hamlet of Stubwood.Industry in the area consists of J.C.Bamford Ltd.- manufacturers of earth moving machinery - and a cotton mill.Local educational establishments include two 5-9 First schools,one 9-13 Middle school,one independant 11-18 school and a Local Authority Residential Care Centre. Places of worship includes St Michael's C.of E.at Rocester,All Saint's C.of E. at Denstone and a Methodist Chapel at Stubwood.Population at Rocester is 1656 and at Denstone is 1231.
